General.Name: Javvy
General.Description:
Javvy is a full-service crypto wallet and exchange. Javvy determines each country's regulatory requirements in advance and requests only the documentation necessary for compliance resulting in a rapid ID verification process that ensures no time is wasted on registration. 

JVY is an ERC 20 token based on the Ethereum blockchain. It will provide a common framework for buying into and selling out of cryptocurrency. Users will have the option to hold, sell, or convert it to nearly any other cryptocurrency.

ICO.Description:
Javvy is a full-service crypto wallet and exchange. Javvy determines each country's regulatory requirements in advance and requests only the documentation necessary for compliance resulting in a rapid ID verification process that ensures no time is wasted on registration. 

JVY is an ERC 20 token based on the Ethereum blockchain. It will provide a common framework for buying into and selling out of cryptocurrency. Users will have the option to hold, sell, or convert it to nearly any other cryptocurrency.

Team:

  • Brandon Elliott: CEO, Chariman of the Board. 
  • Nigel Waller: CFO (Chief Financial Officer). 
  • Tony Ogufere: CCO (Chief Compliance Officer). 
  • Yasitha Bogamuwa: CIO (Chief Information Officer). 
  • Frank Grogan: CMO (Chief Marketing Officer) & Co-Founder. 
  • Harley Grouette: Director of Human Resources. 
  • Andrey Verbin: Lead Developer (Wallet). 
  • Andreas Pachler: Lead Developer (Multiple). 
  • Dmitry Evdokimov: Senior Full-stack Developer. 
  • Duane Roumel: CPO (Chief Product Officer) & Co-Founder. 
  • Michael Lu:  Lead UX/UI Designer. 

Javvy will be holding its ICO on November 1st, 2017. The ICO token supply represents 70% of the total token supply. Each token will be sold for 0.002 ETH at the offering. The ICO funding target is 115,000 ETH, the funding cap is 2,000,000 ETH and is expected to end on November 15, 2017 or when the funding cap is reached. The number of tokens issued per ether will depend on the ethers raised

Token Reserve Split (30%):

  • 1% Bounty Rewards;
  • 10% Operation use;
  • 12% Founding Partners;
  • 3% Advisors
  • 4% Future talents
